(function(){
  var initCookieConsent = function() {
    cookieConsentInit();
    window.cookieconsent.initialise({
      "enabled": true,
      "cookie": {
        "name":"cC",
        "domain":"boardgamearena.com",
        "expiryDays":182
      },
      "palette": {
        "popup": {
          "background": "#4871b6"
        },
        "button": {
          "background": "#fff",
          "text": "#4871b6"
        }
      },
      "revokable":false,
      "revokeBtn":"<span></<span>",
      "theme": "classic",
      "type": "opt-out",
      "content": {
        "message": "We are using cookies for analytics on this website (sorry you cannot eat them 🙂 )<br /><span style=\'font-size:0.8em;line-height:1.1em;\'> This site uses analytical cookies (from the site and from third parties), intended to understand and optimize the navigation experience of its users. If you wish to oppose the use of these cookies, please click on \"Decline\". For more information, please check out our cookie policy:</span>",
        "link": "<span style='font-size:0.8em;line-height:1.1em;'>Read more</span>",
        "dismiss": "Accept",
        "deny": "Decline",
        "href": "/legal?section=cook"
      },
      onInitialise: function(status) {
          if(status == cookieconsent.status.allow) setCookies();
      },
      onStatusChange: function(status) {
          if (this.hasConsented()) setCookies();
      },
    });
  };
  if (document.readyState == "complete") {
    initCookieConsent();
  } else {
    document.addEventListener("readystatechange", function() {
      if (document.readyState == "complete") {
        initCookieConsent();
      }
    });
  }
})();
</script>

            {$('globalerrormsg').innerHTML = msg;  }
        }

    require(["dojo","dojo/_base/unload", "dojo/i18n!ebg/nls/lang_mainsite-20240716", "ebg/core/mainsite","ebg/core/soundManager", "dojo/domReady!"], function( dojo, baseUnload ) {

       ;(function() {
          var dconnect = dojo.connect;
          dojo.connect = function( obj, event, context, method, dontFix ) {
            try
            {
                if( context[ method ] )
                { return dconnect.call( this, obj, event, context, function(){
                    try {  context[ method ].apply( context, arguments ); }
                    catch(e)
                    {
                        if( mainsite )
                        {
                        var msg = 'During callback: '+event+' / '+method+'\n'+e.message+'\n';
                        msg +=  ( e.stack || e.stacktrace || "no_stack_avail" );
                        mainsite.onScriptError( msg, '', '' );                        
                        }
                        else
                        {  throw e; }
                    }
                    }, dontFix );
                }
                else
                {  return dconnect.call( this, obj, event, context, method, dontFix );        }
            }
            catch( e )
            {
                // In case of ANY error during our method, we fallback to normal dojo.connect method
                return dconnect.call( this, obj, event, context, method, dontFix );                
            }  

          };
        })();

Plan your  ..."},{"id":802,"created_at":"2024-07-03 11:31:40","publication_date":"2024-07-10 14:01:00","text":"Frederick II, Holy Roman Emperor and King of Germany and Italy, was a man of extraordinary culture, energy, and ability. His contemporaries called him \"stupor mundi\" (\"the wonder of the world\"), and many historians consider him Europe's first modern ruler. The kingdom Frederick established in Sicily and southern Italy ran on an efficient bureaucracy similar to modern, centrally governed kingdoms.\n\n\u00a0\n\nAs one of Frederick II's vassals in ***Stupor Mundi***, you will summon allies from around the Mediterranean, build structures in your castle, and promote specialists to improve your kingdom. You may improve your chances by upgrading your castles: towers house additional allies, walls store more resources, and keeps aid in managing action cards.\n\n\u00a0\n\nThrough a clever card-selection mechanism, you will have to choose actions carefully, some of which will trigger edicts that affect Frederick's palace, and determine the rewards players may receive from their allies. Do you stay loyal to the Emperor, or do you support independent allies? Keep a close eye on what your opponents do and form alliances at the right time \u2014 or go your own way when things get too heated...\n\n\u00a0\n\n<u>There's a solo rule set if you're alone, or if you can't dare to meet real opponents. But the most courageous vassals will click the link below to start a game in no-time:<\/u>\n\n<https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/gamepanel?game=stupormundi>\n\n\u00a0\n\nWe would love to thanks Nestor Mangone and the Quined Games team for their strong efforts to bring the game to your favorite online board game platform. And let's celebrate as a king Paramesis, the fearless developer who brought Stupor Mundi to Board Game Arena.\\\n\\\nThat's it for your Wednesday release!\n\nUntil Monday, take care and play fair...","title":"STUPOR MUNDI: It's good to be the king!","keywords":"Available Now!\nSolo and up to 4 players\n50 mins","forum_topic_id":37554,"text_fr":"Fr\u00e9d\u00e9ric II, empereur du Saint-Empire romain germanique et roi d'Allemagne et d'Italie, \u00e9tait un homme d'une culture, d'une \u00e9nergie et d'une capacit\u00e9 extraordinaires. Ses contemporains l'appelaient \u00ab stupor mundi \u00bb (\u00ab la merveille du monde \u00bb) et de nombreux historiens le consid\u00e8rent comme le premier dirigeant moderne de l'Europe. Le royaume que Fr\u00e9d\u00e9ric \u00e9tablit en Sicile et dans le sud de l'Italie fonctionnait avec une bureaucratie efficace semblable aux royaumes modernes gouvern\u00e9s de mani\u00e8re centralis\u00e9e.\n\n\u00a0\n\nEn tant que vassal de Fr\u00e9d\u00e9ric II dans ***Stupor Mundi***, vous appellerez des alli\u00e9s du pourtour m\u00e9diterran\u00e9en, construirez des structures dans votre ch\u00e2teau et promouvrez des sp\u00e9cialistes pour am\u00e9liorer votre royaume. Vous pouvez am\u00e9liorer vos chances en am\u00e9liorant vos ch\u00e2teaux : les tours abritent des alli\u00e9s suppl\u00e9mentaires, les murs stockent plus de ressources et conservent une aide \u00e0 la gestion des cartes d'action.\n\n\u00a0\n\nGr\u00e2ce \u00e0 un astucieux m\u00e9canisme de s\u00e9lection de cartes, vous devrez choisir soigneusement les actions, dont certaines d\u00e9clencheront des \u00e9dits qui affecteront le palais de Fr\u00e9d\u00e9ric, et d\u00e9terminez les r\u00e9compenses que les joueurs pourront recevoir de leurs alli\u00e9s. Restez-vous fid\u00e8le \u00e0 l\u2019Empereur ou soutenez-vous des alli\u00e9s ind\u00e9pendants ? His contemporaries called him \"stupor mundi\" (\"the wonder of the world\"), and many historians consider him Europe's first modern ruler. The kingdom Frederick established in Sicily and southern Italy ran on an efficient bureaucracy similar to modern, centrally governed kingdoms.\n\n\u00a0\n\nAs one of Frederick II's vassals in ***Stupor Mundi***, you will summon allies from around the Mediterranean, build structures in your castle, and promote specialists to improve your kingdom. You may improve your chances by upgrading your castles: towers house additional allies, walls store more resources, and keeps aid in managing action cards.\n\n\u00a0\n\nThrough a clever card-selection mechanism, you will have to choose actions carefully, some of which will trigger edicts that affect Frederick's palace, and determine the rewards players may receive from their allies. Do you stay loyal to the Emperor, or do you support independent allies? Keep a close eye on what your opponents do and form alliances at the right time \u2014 or go your own way when things get too heated...\n\n\u00a0\n\n<u>There's a solo rule set if you're alone, or if you can't dare to meet real opponents. g\u00e9n\u00e9ral, voici ce qui se passe :\n\n- Pour les jeux qui ont 5 ou 6 ligues diff\u00e9rentes, tous les joueurs descendent de 3 ligues.\n- Pour les jeux qui ont 4 ligues diff\u00e9rentes, tous Act quickly to use your powers early...or wait to unleash them at full strength. Your path to victory is full of choices and combined tactics!\n\n\u00a0\n\nIn ***SpellBook***, each player, accompanied by a familiar, possesses a grimoire and collects Materia to master spells and feed their familiar. The game provides pre-drawn spell sets for use in the early rounds, but soon players start drawing spells randomly or create their own spell combinations that are common to all players. Each spell combination gives an effect that lasts the rest of the game, and the more ingenious the combination, the more powerful the effect. As the rounds progress, the game becomes a different experience every time, with more than 2,100 spell combinations being possible.\n\n\u00a0\n\nThe game ends as soon as a magician's grimoire is complete or a familiar is fully fed, then the player with the most points wins.\n\n\u00a0\n\n*<u>SpellBook<\/u>*<u> includes a solo mode that closely mirrors the multiplayer experience, offering a high level of challenge and an excellent way to learn the game's rules. Aaaaand you.","original_keywords":"Available Now!\n1 to 4 players\n20 minutes"},"text_excerpt":"A wide variety of spell combinations, play hundreds of unique games.\n\u00a0\nBecome the greatest wizard of the Annual Grand Rite by collecting and managing your Materia to feed your familiar and learn your spells. Act quickly to use your powers early...or wait to unleash them at full strength. Your path to victory is full of choices and combined tactics!\n\u00a0\nIn SpellBook, each player, accompanied by a  ..."},{"id":800,"created_at":"2024-07-03 10:27:57","publication_date":"2024-07-03 14:02:00","text":"At the turn of the 16th Century, King Manuel I commissioned Portugal's greatest artisans to construct grandiose buildings. After completing the Palaces of Evora and Sintra, the king sought to build a summer pavilion to honor the most famous members of the royal family. This construction was intended for the most talented artisans \u2014 whose skills meet the splendor that the royal family deserves. Sadly, King Manuel I died before construction ever began.\n\n\u00a0\n\nIn ***Azul: Summer Pavilion***, players return to Portugal to accomplish the task that never began. As a master artisan, you must use the finest materials to create the summer pavilion while carefully avoiding wasting supplies. Only the best will rise to the challenge to honor the Portuguese royal family.\n\n\u00a0\n\n*Azul: Summer Pavilion* lasts six rounds, and in each round players draft tiles, then place them on their individual player board to score points. Each of the six colors of tiles is wild during one of the rounds.\n\n\u00a0\n\nAt the start of each round, draw tiles at random from the bag to refill each of the factories with four tiles each. Draw tiles as needed to refill the ten supply spaces on the central scoring board. Players then take turns drafting tiles. You can choose to take all of the tiles of a non-wild color on a factory and place them next to your board; if any wild tiles are on this factory, you must take one of them. Place all remaining tiles in the center of the table. Alternatively, you can take all tiles of a non-wild color from the center of play; you must also take one wild tile, if present.\n\n\u00a0\n\nAfter all tiles have been claimed, players then take turns placing tiles on their individual boards. Each board depicts seven stars that would be composed of six tiles; each space on a star shows a number from 1-6, and six of the stars are for tiles of a single color while the seventh will be composed of one tile of each color. To place a tile on the blue 5, for example, you must discard five blue or wild tiles from next to your player board (with at least one blue being required), placing one blue tile in the blue 5 space and the rest in the discard tower. You score 1 point for this tile and 1 point for each tile within this star connected to the newly placed tile.\n\n\u00a0\n\nIf you completely surround a pillar, statue, or window on your game board with tiles, you get an immediate bonus, taking 1-3 tiles from the central supply spaces and placing them next to your board. At the end of the round, you can carry over at most four tiles to the next round; discard any others, losing 1 point for each such tile.\n\n\u00a0\n\nAfter six rounds, you score a bonus for each of the seven stars that you've filled completely. Additionally, you score a bonus for having covered all seven spaces of value 1, 2, 3 or 4. You lose 1 point for each remaining tile unused, then whoever has the most points wins.\n\n\u00a0\n\n<u>This game is quite different from the original Azul, and that's a game you should definitely discover and play right now on BGA. Click the link below to start a game:<\/u>\n\n<https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/gamepanel?game=azulsummerpavilion>\n\n\u00a0\n\nAll of our thanks goes to the **Plan B Games** team and **Michael Kiesling** for their enthousiasm to bring this game to our platform. Apr\u00e8s avoir achev\u00e9 les palais d'Evora et de Sintra, le roi chercha \u00e0 construire un pavillon d'\u00e9t\u00e9 pour honorer les membres les plus c\u00e9l\u00e8bres de la famille royale. Cette construction \u00e9tait destin\u00e9e aux artisans les plus talentueux, dont les comp\u00e9tences r\u00e9pondent \u00e0 la splendeur que m\u00e9rite la famille royale. Malheureusement, le roi Manuel Ier est d\u00e9c\u00e9d\u00e9 avant le d\u00e9but des travaux.\n\n\u00a0\n\nDans ***Azul : Pavillon d'\u00e9t\u00e9***, les joueurs retournent au Portugal pour accomplir une t\u00e2che qui n'a jamais commenc\u00e9. En tant que ma\u00eetre artisan, vous devez utiliser les meilleurs mat\u00e9riaux pour cr\u00e9er le pavillon d\u2019\u00e9t\u00e9 tout en \u00e9vitant soigneusement le gaspillage de fournitures. Seuls les meilleurs rel\u00e8veront le d\u00e9fi d\u2019honorer la famille royale portugaise.\n\n\u00a0\n\n*Azul\u00a0:\u00a0Pavillon d'\u00e9t\u00e9* dure six tours, et \u00e0 chaque tour, les joueurs tirent des tuiles, puis les placent sur leur plateau individuel pour marquer des points. Chacune des six couleurs de tuiles est un joker pendant l'un des tours.\n\n\u00a0\n\nAu d\u00e9but de chaque tour, piochez des tuiles au hasard dans le sac pour remplir chacune des usines avec quatre tuiles chacune. Piochez des tuiles selon vos besoins pour remplir les dix espaces de ravitaillement sur le tableau de score central. Les joueurs piochent ensuite \u00e0 tour de r\u00f4le des tuiles. Vous pouvez choisir de prendre toutes les tuiles d'une couleur qui ne soit pas un joker sur une usine et de les placer \u00e0 c\u00f4t\u00e9 de votre plateau ; si des tuiles joker se trouvent sur cette usine, vous devez en prendre une. Placez toutes les tuiles restantes au centre de la table. Alternativement, vous pouvez prendre toutes les tuiles d'une couleur qui ne soit pas un joker du centre du jeu ; vous devez \u00e9galement prendre une tuile joker, si elle est pr\u00e9sente.\n\n\u00a0\n\nUne fois que toutes les tuiles ont \u00e9t\u00e9 r\u00e9clam\u00e9es, les joueurs placent \u00e0 tour de r\u00f4le les tuiles sur leurs plateaux individuels. Chaque plateau repr\u00e9sente sept \u00e9toiles qui seraient compos\u00e9es de six tuiles\u00a0; chaque espace sur une \u00e9toile montre un nombre de 1 \u00e0 6, et six des \u00e9toiles sont destin\u00e9es \u00e0 des carreaux d'une seule couleur tandis que la septi\u00e8me sera compos\u00e9e d'un carreau de chaque couleur. Pour placer une tuile sur le 5 bleu, par exemple, vous devez d\u00e9fausser cinq tuiles bleues ou joker \u00e0 c\u00f4t\u00e9 de votre plateau de joueur (au moins une bleue \u00e9tant requise), en pla\u00e7ant une tuile bleue dans l'espace bleu 5 et le reste dans l'espace bleu 5. jeter la tour. Vous marquez 1 point pour cette tuile et 1 point pour chaque tuile de cette \u00e9toile connect\u00e9e \u00e0 la tuile nouvellement plac\u00e9e.\n\n\u00a0\n\nSi vous entourez compl\u00e8tement un pilier, une statue ou une fen\u00eatre de votre plateau de jeu de tuiles, vous obtenez un bonus imm\u00e9diat, en prenant 1 \u00e0 3 tuiles des espaces de r\u00e9serve centraux et en les pla\u00e7ant \u00e0 c\u00f4t\u00e9 de votre plateau. \u00c0 la fin du tour, vous pouvez reporter au maximum quatre tuiles au tour suivant\u00a0; d\u00e9faussez toutes les autres, perdant 1 point pour chacune de ces tuiles.\n\n\u00a0\n\nApr\u00e8s six tours, vous obtenez un bonus pour chacune des sept \u00e9toiles que vous avez compl\u00e8tement remplies. After completing the Palaces of Evora and Sintra, the king sought to build a summer pavilion to honor the most famous members of the royal family. This construction was intended for the most talented artisans \u2014 whose skills meet the splendor that the royal family deserves. Sadly, King Manuel I died before construction ever began.\n\n\u00a0\n\nIn ***Azul: Summer Pavilion***, players return to Portugal to accomplish the task that never began. As a master artisan, you must use the finest materials to create the summer pavilion while carefully avoiding wasting supplies. Only the best will rise to the challenge to honor the Portuguese royal family.\n\n\u00a0\n\n*Azul: Summer Pavilion* lasts six rounds, and in each round players draft tiles, then place them on their individual player board to score points. Each of the six colors of tiles is wild during one of the rounds.\n\n\u00a0\n\nAt the start of each round, draw tiles at random from the bag to refill each of the factories with four tiles each. Draw tiles as needed to refill the ten supply spaces on the central scoring board. Players then take turns drafting tiles. You can choose to take all of the tiles of a non-wild color on a factory and place them next to your board; if any wild tiles are on this factory, you must take one of them. Place all remaining tiles in the center of the table. Alternatively, you can take all tiles of a non-wild color from the center of play; you must also take one wild tile, if present.\n\n\u00a0\n\nAfter all tiles have been claimed, players then take turns placing tiles on their individual boards. Each board depicts seven stars that would be composed of six tiles; each space on a star shows a number from 1-6, and six of the stars are for tiles of a single color while the seventh will be composed of one tile of each color. To place a tile on the blue 5, for example, you must discard five blue or wild tiles from next to your player board (with at least one blue being required), placing one blue tile in the blue 5 space and the rest in the discard tower. You score 1 point for this tile and 1 point for each tile within this star connected to the newly placed tile.\n\n\u00a0\n\nIf you completely surround a pillar, statue, or window on your game board with tiles, you get an immediate bonus, taking 1-3 tiles from the central supply spaces and placing them next to your board. At the end of the round, you can carry over at most four tiles to the next round; discard any others, losing 1 point for each such tile.\n\n\u00a0\n\nAfter six rounds, you score a bonus for each of the seven stars that you've filled completely. Additionally, you score a bonus for having covered all seven spaces of value 1, 2, 3 or 4. You lose 1 point for each remaining tile unused, then whoever has the most points wins.\n\n\u00a0\n\n<u>This game is quite different from the original Azul, and that's a game you should definitely discover and play right now on BGA. ","original_keywords":"Available Now!\n2 to 4 Players\n15 mins"},"text_excerpt":"...stays on Board Game Arena!\n\u00a0\nFeel the electric atmosphere around a casino slot machine!\nMega Jackpot is a card game crafted to capture the electric atmosphere of a casino slot machine.\n\n\nTurn over cards to align three matching symbols to hit the Jackpot!\nBut the excitement doesn't stop there \u2013 gamble your winnings and flip a tile for a shot at the elusive Mega Jackpot.\nFor the true thrill- ..."},{"id":797,"created_at":"2024-06-24 10:52:56","publication_date":"2024-06-24 14:01:00","text":"You and your opponent are rival time travelers trying to erase each other from history. To prove you are the one true inventor of time travel, you must use your invention to find your enemy in time and murder them \u2014 before they get you!\n\nUnfortunately, since your enemy has strewn many copies of themself across the timeline, you may have to do the terrible deed many, many times before it works. Just make sure you don't get erased first!\n\n***That Time You Killed Me*** is an abstract narrative game of time and murder that introduces new scenarios with unique rules and components as you play. As with any game about mucking about across time, you must play through this content in *a strict, unalterable order*.\n\n\u00a0\n\nTo set up, place three game boards in a row to represent past, present, and future. Each player starts with a player piece in the same location on each 4x4 board, with the start player having their *focus token* in the past while the other has it in the future.\n\n\u00a0\n\nOn a turn, choose a single copy of yourself on the board where your focus token is located, then take two actions with this copy, with actions being movement to an adjacent orthogonal space, time travel forward to the next board (travel from the past to the future is not allowed), or time travel back to the previous board, leaving a copy of yourself in the current location when you do. Sure, you traveled to the past, but if you stick around long enough, you'll be right back where you started, so now you're there, too! At the end of your turn, move your focus token to a different board.\n\n\u00a0\n\nUnder the basic rules, you murder a copy of your opponent by pushing them into the wall of the game board. You have a limited number of copies of yourself in reserve, and murdered copies don't return to your reserve because that would be gross. If you run out of copies, you can no longer travel to the past since you can't leave a copy of yourself behind.\n\nIf on your turn, your opponent has copies of themselves on only one board, you win!\n\nPlay through four chapters of escalating difficulty, adding more wild time-travel shenanigans and unlocking more content as you master the game!\n\n\u00a0\n\n<u>There is of course <\/u>[<u>a nice tutorial you can play to learn about the game mechanics<\/u>](https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/tutorial?game=thattimeyoukilledme)<u>, and the link below will guide you to the gamepage:<\/u>\n\n<https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/gamepanel?game=thattimeyoukilledme>\n\n\u00a0\n\nLet's thanks the **Pandasaurus Games** team and the work done by **Sir Heo** to bring the game to the platform, with the authorization from **Peter C. Hayward**, the game designer.\\\nLet's celebrate this very particular game today and let's play it to discover something really new and really cool!\n\n\u00a0\n\nThat's it for your Monday breakfast.\\\nSee you on Wednesday, and until then...\\\n*Take care and play fair!*","title":"THAT TIME YOU KILLED ME: Murder, time and space.","keywords":"Available Now!\n2 players only\n20 mins","forum_topic_id":37314,"text_fr":"Vous et votre adversaire \u00eates des voyageurs temporels rivaux qui tentent de s'effacer mutuellement de l'histoire. Pour prouver que vous \u00eates le seul v\u00e9ritable inventeur du voyage dans le temps, vous devez utiliser votre invention pour trouver votre ennemi \u00e0 temps et l'assassiner \u2014 avant qu'il ne vous attrape !\n\nMalheureusement, puisque votre ennemi a \u00e9parpill\u00e9 de nombreuses copies de lui-m\u00eame \u00e0 travers la chronologie, vous devrez peut-\u00eatre commettre cet acte terrible de tr\u00e8s nombreuses fois avant qu'il ne persiste. Assurez-vous simplement de ne pas \u00eatre effac\u00e9 en premier\u00a0!\n\n***That Time You Killed Me*** est un jeu narratif abstrait sur le temps et le meurtre qui introduit de nouveaux sc\u00e9narios avec des r\u00e8gles et des composants uniques au fur et \u00e0 mesure que vous jouez. Comme pour tout jeu sur le voyage \u00e0 travers le temps, vous devez jouer \u00e0 ce contenu dans *un ordre strict et inalt\u00e9rable*.\n\n\u00a0\n\nPour l'installer, placez trois plateaux de jeu d'affil\u00e9e pour repr\u00e9senter le pass\u00e9, le pr\u00e9sent et le futur. Chaque joueur commence avec une pi\u00e8ce de joueur au m\u00eame endroit sur chaque plateau 4x4, le premier joueur ayant son *jeton de concentration* dans le pass\u00e9 tandis que l'autre l'a dans le futur.\n\n\u00a0\n\nLors d'un tour, choisissez une seule copie de vous-m\u00eame sur le plateau o\u00f9 se trouve votre jeton de concentration, puis effectuez deux actions avec cette copie, les actions \u00e9tant le d\u00e9placement vers un espace orthogonal adjacent, le voyage dans le temps jusqu'au plateau suivant (voyage depuis le pass\u00e9 vers le futur n'est pas autoris\u00e9), ou voyager dans le temps jusqu'au tableau pr\u00e9c\u00e9dent, laissant une copie de vous-m\u00eame \u00e0 l'emplacement actuel lorsque vous le faites. Bien s\u00fbr, vous avez voyag\u00e9 dans le pass\u00e9, mais si vous restez assez longtemps, vous serez de retour l\u00e0 o\u00f9 vous avez commenc\u00e9, alors maintenant vous y \u00eates aussi\u00a0! \u00c0 la fin de votre tour, d\u00e9placez votre jeton Concentration vers un autre plateau.\n\n\u00a0\n\nSelon les r\u00e8gles de base, vous assassinez une copie de votre adversaire en le poussant contre le mur du plateau de jeu. Vous avez un nombre limit\u00e9 de copies de vous-m\u00eame en r\u00e9serve, et les copies assassin\u00e9es ne retournent pas dans votre r\u00e9serve car cela serait r\u00e9pugnant. Si vous manquez de copies, vous ne pouvez plus voyager dans le pass\u00e9 puisque vous ne pouvez pas laisser de copie de vous-m\u00eame derri\u00e8re vous.\n\nSi \u00e0 votre tour, votre adversaire poss\u00e8de des copies de lui-m\u00eame sur un seul plateau, vous gagnez !\n\nJouez \u00e0 quatre chapitres de difficult\u00e9 croissante, en ajoutant des manigances de voyage dans le temps encore plus sauvages et en d\u00e9verrouillant plus de contenu \u00e0 mesure que vous ma\u00eetrisez le jeu\u00a0!\n\n\u00a0\n\n<u>Il y a bien s\u00fbr <\/u>[<u>un joli tutoriel auquel vous pouvez jouer pour en savoir plus sur les m\u00e9caniques du jeu<\/u>](https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/tutorial?game=thattimeyoukilledme)<u>, et le lien ci-dessous vous guidera vers la page du jeu :<\/u>\n\n<https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/gamepanel?game=thattimeyoukilledme>\n\n\u00a0\n\nRemercions l'\u00e9quipe de **Pandasaurus Games** et le travail effectu\u00e9 par **Sir Heo** pour amener le jeu sur la plateforme, avec l'autorisation de **Peter C. From his castle in Prague, he oversees construction of new fortifications: a bridge across the Vltava River, a university, and a cathedral rising within the walls of the castle itself. Prague is already among the largest cities in Europe. King Charles will make it the capital of an empire!\n\n\u00a0\n\nIn ***Praga Caput Regni***, players take the role of wealthy citizens who are organizing various building projects in medieval Prague. By expanding their wealth and joining in the construction, they gain favor with the king. Players choose from six actions on the game board- the \"action crane\"- that are always available, but which are weighted with a constantly shifting array of costs and benefits. By using these actions, you can increase your resources, improve the strength of your chosen actions, and build \"New Prague City,\" the Charles Bridge, or city walls. You can possibly gain additional actions or even participate in the construction of St. Vitus Cathedral.\n\n\u00a0\n\nClever players will discover synergies between carefully timed actions and the rewards from constructing civic projects as all of the mechanisms mesh together. At the end of the game, the player who most impressed King Charles wins.\n\n\u00a0\n\nThe game has won many awards, and for a solid reason: it's a very nice city-building game with area majority\/influence managed on a big beautiful board.\\\n\\\n<u>Curious about it? On their turn, they either place a face up tile OR place a face down tile. If they cannot do either, they show their tiles and pass, drawing 2 tiles.\\\nEach face up tile must be placed adjacent to an already placed tile as long as it remains within a 4x4 grid or 5x5 grid. If you place a new Front tile, you draw 2 Tiles, these can be covered by Back tiles.\n\n\u00a0\n\nIf you place a back tile it must \"beat\" a face-up tile by respecting Rock-Paper-Scissors. You do not draw and these tiles are \u201cblocked\u201d, because you cannot cover them.\\\nYou have 2 different possibilities to win: by aligning 3 Front tiles of your colour or by aligning 3 Back tiles of your colour.\n\n\u00a0\n\nDo not underestimate your opponents and pay attention to the game. Remember to cover all your fronts as victory comes in 2 different ways!\n\n\u00a0\n\n<u>It's our Monday release, <\/u>[<u>and a tutorial is available, as well as more information<\/u>](https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/tutorial?game=linx)<u> on the game page of this title, by clicking the link below:<\/u>\n\n<https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/gamepanel?game=linx>\n\n\u00a0\n\nLet's thank **Fabrice Puleo** and the **Matagot team** for making it happen on #BGA, as well as for **tchobello** who developed this game on our platform.\n\n\u00a0\n\nThat's it for this Monday, see you in a few days!\n\n*Until then... S'ils ne peuvent faire ni l'un ni l'autre, ils montrent leurs tuiles et passent (piochez 2 tuiles).\\\nChaque tuile face visible doit \u00eatre plac\u00e9e \u00e0 c\u00f4t\u00e9 d'une tuile d\u00e9j\u00e0 plac\u00e9e tant qu'elle reste dans une grille 4x4 ou 5x5. Si vous placez une nouvelle tuile Recto, vous piochez 2 tuiles, celles-ci peuvent \u00eatre recouvertes par des tuiles Verso.\n\n\u00a0\n\nSi vous placez une tuile Recto, elle doit \"battre\" une tuile face visible en respectant le \"pierre-papier-ciseaux\". Vous ne piochez pas et ces tuiles sont \u00ab bloqu\u00e9es \u00bb, car vous ne pouvez pas les recouvrir.\\\nVous avez 2 possibilit\u00e9s diff\u00e9rentes pour gagner : en alignant 3 tuiles Recto de votre couleur ou en alignant 3 tuiles Verso de votre couleur.\n\n\u00a0\n\nNe sous-estimez pas vos adversaires et faites attention au jeu. On their turn, they either place a face up tile OR place a face down tile. If they cannot do either, they show their tiles and pass, drawing 2 tiles.\\\nEach face up tile must be placed adjacent to an already placed tile as long as it remains within a 4x4 grid or 5x5 grid. If you place a new Front tile, you draw 2 Tiles, these can be covered by Back tiles.\n\n\u00a0\n\nIf you place a back tile it must \"beat\" a face-up tile by respecting Rock-Paper-Scissors. You do not draw and these tiles are \u201cblocked\u201d, because you cannot cover them.\\\nYou have 2 different possibilities to win: by aligning 3 Front tiles of your colour or by aligning 3 Back tiles of your colour.\n\n\u00a0\n\nDo not underestimate your opponents and pay attention to the game. Take care and play fair.*\n\n\u00a0\n\n\u00a0\n\n\u00a0\n\n\u00a0","original_title":"LINX: Tactic tac toe!","original_keywords":"Available Now!\n2 to 4 players\n5 minutes"},"text_excerpt":"A clever mix of tic-tac-toe and rock-paper-scissors in 5 mins!\n\u00a0\nPlayers take turns clockwise. On their turn, they either place a face up tile OR place a face down tile. If they cannot do either, they show their tiles and pass, drawing 2 tiles.\nEach face up tile must be placed adjacent to an already placed tile as long as it remains within a 4x4 grid or 5x5 grid. If you place a new Front tile,  ..."},{"id":792,"created_at":"2024-06-05 11:17:20","publication_date":"2024-06-05 14:01:00","text":"Battle Spirits Saga is a deeply strategic trading card game played with cards and cores. (TCG stands for TRADING CARD GAME) Do not worry, everything is included. ;)\n\n\u00a0\n\nUse three types of cards to craft your deck.\n\nCores are the essence of Battle Spirits Saga's unique gameplay system.\n\nHow you make use of your limited cores during a game determines the flow of battle, leading to endless possibilities!\n\n\u00a0\n\n**Games of Battle Spirits Saga are won in one of two ways.**\n\nThe first is by reducing your opponent\u2019s life total to zero by attacking them with your Spirits.\n\nBy hitting your opponent with Spirits, you reduce their life cores by the total number of symbols in your attacking creatures\u2019 bottom right corner: for instance, if you hit with two creatures with one symbol each, your opponent will lose two life cores.\n\nThe second way will be one familiar to most TCG players, known as \u2018decking out\u2019. If you go to your start step with no cards left in your deck, you immediately lose the game regardless of how many life cores you had left remaining.\n\nOf course, there are other potential outcomes, such as both players winning at the same time (resulting in a draw), or one player conceding the game and losing as a result.\n\n\u00a0\n\n**Each turn is divided into seven steps:**\n\n**Start Step:** This step is more about checking the condition of the board. Any effects that say they happen in the Start step are resolved, and the active player must check to see if they still have cards in their deck. If they don\u2019t, they immediately lose the game.\n\n**Core Step:** The active player puts one core from their Void into their Reserve. Any effects that trigger now are also resolved. The first player does not have a Core step on their first turn.\n\n**Draw Step:** This step is simple enough: the active player draws a card. If any effects trigger now, they are also resolved.\n\n**Refresh Step:** In the Refresh Step, every currently-exhausted card (those turned 90 degrees) are returned to their normal position. Cores in your Trash area are moved back into your Reserve, and any effects triggered by this step are resolved.\n\n**Main Step:** This is the earliest point in the turn where you can play cards. In the Main Step, you can play Spirit, Nexus, and Magic cards, level up cards already on the field, set cards in your Burst area, activate abilities on cards, or merely move on to the next step.\n\n**Attack Step:** This is when combat happens, and the active player can decide which Spirits they are attacking with, while the defending player can choose their blockers. Alongside combat, this step also includes two Flash Windows where cards with flash abilities can be played.\n\n**End Step:** In the End Step, any effects that specifically trigger during the end step, or last until the end of the turn, are resolved. After this, the turn ends, and the next player begins again at the Start Step.\n\n\u00a0\n\nThat is quite a big and great game and one of the first of the genre to come to Board Game Arena!\n\n\\\nReady to build your deck and fight ? Click the link below to discover more about it and join a table right from your browser:\n\n<https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/gamepanel?game=battlespiritssaga>\n\n**To customize your deck, you SHOULD start a SOLO game to be able to built it before a 2 player match.**\n\n\u00a0\n\nWe would love to thank everyone involved in this adaptation, and especially BANDAI Co., Ltd. for their authorization and confidence to bring their game on our platform.\\\nObviously, when there is a game on #BGA, there is at least one developer behind it, and this one is brought to you by LeSteffen. Let's also thank Michael Elliot and Mitsuhiro Nakazawa, the game designers, for their work done on this title.\\\n\\\nThat's it for this WRT (Wednesday Release Time)!\n\nIn an effort to bring various games and gameplays to you, we are all very happy to share you this unique one.\n\nSee you around in a few days!\n\nUntil then... take care and play fair! (always ;) )","title":"BATTLE SPIRITS SAGA: Build your decks and battle in this TCG right from JAPAN!","keywords":"Available Now!\n2 Players\n15 mins","forum_topic_id":37002,"text_fr":"**Battle Spirits Saga** est un jeu de cartes \u00e0 collectionner profond\u00e9ment strat\u00e9gique jou\u00e9 avec des cartes et des ressources (core). (TCG signifie TRADING CARD GAME ou JCC - JEU DE CARTE A COLLECTIONNER) Ne vous inqui\u00e9tez pas, tout est inclus ;)\n\n\u00a0\n\nUtilisez trois types de cartes pour cr\u00e9er votre deck.\n\nLes \"cores\" sont l'essence m\u00eame du syst\u00e8me de jeu unique de Battle Spirits Saga.\n\nLa fa\u00e7on dont vous les utilisez pendant une partie d\u00e9termine le d\u00e9roulement de la bataille, ouvrant ainsi la voie \u00e0 des possibilit\u00e9s infinies\u00a0!\n\n\u00a0\n\n**Les parties de Battle Spirits Saga se gagnent de deux mani\u00e8res.**\n\nLa premi\u00e8re consiste \u00e0 r\u00e9duire le total de points de vie de votre adversaire \u00e0 z\u00e9ro en l'attaquant avec vos Esprits.\n\nEn frappant votre adversaire avec des Esprits, vous r\u00e9duisez ses \"cores\" de vie du nombre total de symboles, indiqu\u00e9s dans le coin inf\u00e9rieur droit de vos cr\u00e9atures attaquantes. Par exemple, si vous frappez avec deux cr\u00e9atures ayant un symbole chacune, votre adversaire perdra deux \"cores\" de vie.\n\nLa deuxi\u00e8me m\u00e9thode sera famili\u00e8re \u00e0 la plupart des joueurs de JCC, connue sous le nom de \u00ab terrassement \u00bb. Si vous passez \u00e0 votre \u00e9tape de d\u00e9part sans aucune carte dans votre deck, vous perdez imm\u00e9diatement la partie, quel que soit le nombre de \"cores\" de vie qu'il vous reste.\n\nBien s\u00fbr, il existe d'autres situations potentielles, comme le fait que les deux joueurs peuvent gagner en m\u00eame temps (ce qui entra\u00eene un match nul) ou qu'un joueur conc\u00e8de la partie et perd en cons\u00e9quence.\n\n\u00a0\n\n**Chaque tour est divis\u00e9 en sept \u00e9tapes\u00a0:**\n\n**\u00c9tape de d\u00e9marrage\u00a0:** Cette \u00e9tape consiste davantage \u00e0 v\u00e9rifier l'\u00e9tat de la carte. Tous les effets qui indiquent qu'ils se produisent \u00e0 l'\u00e9tape de d\u00e9marrage sont r\u00e9solus et le joueur actif doit v\u00e9rifier s'il a encore des cartes dans son deck. S\u2019ils ne le font pas, ils perdent imm\u00e9diatement la partie.\n\n**\u00c9tape de base\u00a0:** L'\u00e9tape de base permet au joueur actif de placer un \"core\" de son \"Vide\" dans sa r\u00e9serve. Tous les effets cens\u00e9s se d\u00e9clencher maintenant sont \u00e9galement r\u00e9solus. Le premier joueur n'a pas d'\u00e9tape \"core\" \u00e0 son premier tour.\n\n**\u00c9tape de tirage\u00a0:** Cette \u00e9tape est assez simple\u00a0: le joueur actif pioche une carte. Si des effets se d\u00e9clenchent imm\u00e9diatement, ils sont \u00e9galement r\u00e9solus.\n\n**\u00c9tape d'actualisation\u00a0:** Lors de l'\u00e9tape d'actualisation, toutes les cartes actuellement \u00e9puis\u00e9es (celles tourn\u00e9es \u00e0 90\u00a0degr\u00e9s) sont remises dans leur position normale. Les \"cores\" de votre zone de d\u00e9fausse sont replac\u00e9s dans votre R\u00e9serve et tous les effets d\u00e9clench\u00e9s par cette \u00e9tape sont r\u00e9solus.\n\n**\u00c9tape principale\u00a0:** Il s'agit du premier moment du tour o\u00f9 vous pouvez jouer des cartes. Dans la premi\u00e8re \u00e9tape, vous pouvez jouer des cartes Esprit, Nexus et Magie, am\u00e9liorer les cartes d\u00e9j\u00e0 sur le terrain, placer des cartes dans votre zone Burst, activer des capacit\u00e9s sur des cartes ou simplement passer \u00e0 l'\u00e9tape suivante.\n\n**\u00c9tape d'attaque\u00a0:** C'est \u00e0 ce moment-l\u00e0 que le combat a lieu et que le joueur actif peut d\u00e9cider avec quels esprits il attaque, tandis que le joueur d\u00e9fenseur peut choisir ses bloqueurs. En plus du combat, cette \u00e9tape comprend \u00e9galement deux fen\u00eatres Flash o\u00f9 des cartes dot\u00e9es de capacit\u00e9s Flash peuvent \u00eatre jou\u00e9es.\n\n**\u00c9tape de fin\u00a0:** Lors de l'\u00e9tape de fin, tous les effets qui se d\u00e9clenchent sp\u00e9cifiquement pendant l'\u00e9tape de fin, ou durent jusqu'\u00e0 la fin du tour, sont r\u00e9solus. Apr\u00e8s cela, le tour se termine et le joueur suivant recommence \u00e0 l'\u00e9tape de d\u00e9part.\n\n\u00a0\n\n**C'est un jeu riche et g\u00e9nial, mais surtout l'un des premiers de son genre \u00e0 arriver sur Board Game Arena!**\n\n\\\n<u>Pr\u00eat \u00e0 construire votre deck et \u00e0 combattre ? (toujours ;) )*","title_fr":"BATTLE SPIRITS SAGA: Construisez vos decks et combattez dans ce TCG venu tout droit du JAPON !","keywords_fr":"Disponible Maintenant !\n2 joueurs\n15 mins","forum_topic_id_fr":37003,"comments_count":22,"comments_count_fr":1,"image_timestamp":"2024-06-05 11:17:20","publish_on_bga":true,"publish_on_forum":true,"game_ids":[1962],"colors":["#282F33","#4e5c64","#5e6278","#384745"],"blurhash":"L485Az%g8wxvIAR-*0kW00jE%$V?","priority":2,"image_url":"https:\/\/x.boardgamearena.net\/data\/newsimg\/news-banner-792.jpg?ts=1717607840","image_url_400":"https:\/\/x.boardgamearena.net\/data\/newsimg\/news-banner-792_400.jpg?ts=1717607840","status":{"bga":{"status":"published","url":"https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/news?id=792"},"forum":{"status":"published","url":"https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/forum\/viewtopic.php?t=37002"},"forum_fr":{"status":"published","url":"https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/forum\/viewtopic.php?t=37003"}},"translation":{"translated":false,"lang":"en","human_translated_percent":null,"human_translated_category":null,"human_translated_message":null,"original_text":"Battle Spirits Saga is a deeply strategic trading card game played with cards and cores. (TCG stands for TRADING CARD GAME) Do not worry, everything is included. ;)\n\n\u00a0\n\nUse three types of cards to craft your deck.\n\nCores are the essence of Battle Spirits Saga's unique gameplay system.\n\nHow you make use of your limited cores during a game determines the flow of battle, leading to endless possibilities!\n\n\u00a0\n\n**Games of Battle Spirits Saga are won in one of two ways.**\n\nThe first is by reducing your opponent\u2019s life total to zero by attacking them with your Spirits.\n\nBy hitting your opponent with Spirits, you reduce their life cores by the total number of symbols in your attacking creatures\u2019 bottom right corner: for instance, if you hit with two creatures with one symbol each, your opponent will lose two life cores.\n\nThe second way will be one familiar to most TCG players, known as \u2018decking out\u2019. If you go to your start step with no cards left in your deck, you immediately lose the game regardless of how many life cores you had left remaining.\n\nOf course, there are other potential outcomes, such as both players winning at the same time (resulting in a draw), or one player conceding the game and losing as a result.\n\n\u00a0\n\n**Each turn is divided into seven steps:**\n\n**Start Step:** This step is more about checking the condition of the board. Any effects that say they happen in the Start step are resolved, and the active player must check to see if they still have cards in their deck. If they don\u2019t, they immediately lose the game.\n\n**Core Step:** The active player puts one core from their Void into their Reserve. Any effects that trigger now are also resolved. The first player does not have a Core step on their first turn.\n\n**Draw Step:** This step is simple enough: the active player draws a card. If any effects trigger now, they are also resolved.\n\n**Refresh Step:** In the Refresh Step, every currently-exhausted card (those turned 90 degrees) are returned to their normal position. Cores in your Trash area are moved back into your Reserve, and any effects triggered by this step are resolved.\n\n**Main Step:** This is the earliest point in the turn where you can play cards. In the Main Step, you can play Spirit, Nexus, and Magic cards, level up cards already on the field, set cards in your Burst area, activate abilities on cards, or merely move on to the next step.\n\n**Attack Step:** This is when combat happens, and the active player can decide which Spirits they are attacking with, while the defending player can choose their blockers. Alongside combat, this step also includes two Flash Windows where cards with flash abilities can be played.\n\n**End Step:** In the End Step, any effects that specifically trigger during the end step, or last until the end of the turn, are resolved. After this, the turn ends, and the next player begins again at the Start Step.\n\n\u00a0\n\nThat is quite a big and great game and one of the first of the genre to come to Board Game Arena!\n\n\\\nReady to build your deck and fight ? Click the link below to discover more about it and join a table right from your browser:\n\n<https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/gamepanel?game=battlespiritssaga>\n\n**To customize your deck, you SHOULD start a SOLO game to be able to built it before a 2 player match.**\n\n\u00a0\n\nWe would love to thank everyone involved in this adaptation, and especially BANDAI Co., Ltd. for their authorization and confidence to bring their game on our platform.\\\nObviously, when there is a game on #BGA, there is at least one developer behind it, and this one is brought to you by LeSteffen. Let's also thank Michael Elliot and Mitsuhiro Nakazawa, the game designers, for their work done on this title.\\\n\\\nThat's it for this WRT (Wednesday Release Time)!\n\nIn an effort to bring various games and gameplays to you, we are all very happy to share you this unique one.\n\nSee you around in a few days!\n\nUntil then... take care and play fair! (TCG stands for TRADING CARD GAME) Do not worry, everything is included. ;)\n\u00a0\nUse three types of cards to craft your deck.\nCores are the essence of Battle Spirits Saga's unique gameplay system.\nHow you make use of your limited cores during a game determines the flow of battle, leading to endless possibilities ..."},{"id":791,"created_at":"2024-06-03 10:22:37","publication_date":"2024-06-03 14:01:00","text":"Grumble and smash your way to victory in this whimsically clever polyomino placement game for 1-4 grumpy golems.\n\n\u00a0\n\nTumble, Rumble, Grumble!\n\n\u00a0\n\n##### **Tumble :**\n\nRoll two dice and assign them to your grid by number. One must be vertical (column) and the other horizontal (row).\n\nYou may spend one heart to reroll a die. You may spend two hearts to move one die to an adjacent space (+1\/-1).\n\n\u00a0\n\n##### **Rumble**\n\nActivate all the icons in the assigned column and row.\n\n- **Attack** (brown star) symbols deal damage to one rival (reduce their active shields).\n- **Heart** symbols heal you a health point.\n- **Shield** symbols block incoming attacks.\n- **Grumble** symbols will allow you to upgrade your golem in the next phase...\n\n\u00a0\n\n##### **Grumble**\n\nSpend your grumbles to:\n\n**Purchase Polyominoes** from the market and add these to your grid. They can cover printed symbols but NOT placed polyominoes.\n\n**Purchase Perpetual** tokens (shield or attack). These remain active at all times.\n\n**Banish Polyominoes** (remove them from the game) to heal 1 heart per polyomino banished.\n\n### \n\nAll Golems start without a power.\n\nWhen you fill EITHER a row OR column, activate your **power.**\n\nWhen you fill BOTH a row AND column, activate your **superpower**.\n\n\u00a0\n\nAnd whatever you do, try not to CRUMBLE\u2026\n\n\u00a0\n\nYou can try it right now on our platform, all you have to do is click the link below:\n\n<https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/gamepanel?game=grumblestone>\n\n\u00a0\n\nLet's thank Josh Mc Bride and Blue Fox Games for their authorization to bring this game live on Board Game Arena, and let's not forget the very good work done by n_e_s_s_u_n_o to make it playable online!\n\n\u00a0\n\nThat's it for this Monday.\\\nUntil Wednesday, take care and...\\\nPlay fair!\n\n\u00a0","title":"GRUMBLE STONE: Let's get ready to grumble!","keywords":"Available Now!\n2 to 4 players\n30 mins","forum_topic_id":36961,"text_fr":"Grognez et fracassez votre chemin vers la victoire dans ce jeu de placement polyomino fantaisiste et intelligent pour 1 \u00e0 4 golems grincheux.\n\n\u00a0\n\nTumble, Rumble, Grumble (intraduisible pour garder la rime, mais grossi\u00e8rement : Rouler, Tambouriner et Grumeler!)\n\n\u00a0\n\n##### **Rouler :**\n\nLancez deux d\u00e9s et affectez-les \u00e0 votre grille par num\u00e9ro. L'un doit \u00eatre vertical (colonne) et l'autre horizontal (ligne).\n\nVous pouvez d\u00e9penser un c\u0153ur pour relancer un d\u00e9. But watch out, you will need to keep an eye on your opponents and be one step ahead to win the game!\n\n\u00a0\n\n*Slide* is played over 16 rounds. The game ends when all cards have been revealed and played.\\\nEach round, players choose any face-down card from their grid and turns it face-up, in the middle of the table, at the same time.\n\n\\\nStarting with the first player and continuing clockwise, each player chooses one of the cards from the middle of the table and places it in their grid.\\\nTo place a card in your grid, push (slide) the card into a row or column to fill an empty space and rebuild the 4 by 4 grid. You cannot slide cards diagonally.\\\nYou cannot place a card directly into an empty slot.\n\n\\\nThe First Player counter passes to the player on the left and a new round begins.\\\nWhen every card has been turned over, count up the scores.\n\n\u00a0\n\nEnd of the game: All orthogonally adjacent cards with the same number cancel each other out and are removed from the game.\\\nEach player counts up the values of the remaining cards in their grid. The player\\\nwith the lowest score wins the game.\n\n\u00a0\n\n<u>Ready to slide? Le jeu se termine lorsque toutes les cartes ont \u00e9t\u00e9 r\u00e9v\u00e9l\u00e9es et jou\u00e9es.\\\n\u00c0 chaque tour, les joueurs choisissent une carte face cach\u00e9e de leur grille et la retournent en m\u00eame temps face visible au centre de la table.\n\n\\\nEn commen\u00e7ant par le premier joueur et en continuant dans le sens des aiguilles d'une montre, chaque joueur choisit une carte au milieu de la table et la place dans sa grille.\\\nPour placer une carte dans votre grille, poussez (glissez) la carte dans une ligne ou une colonne pour remplir un espace vide et reconstruire la grille 4 par 4. Les cartes ne peuvent pas \u00eatre gliss\u00e9es en diagonale.\\\nVous ne pouvez pas placer une carte directement dans un emplacement vide.\n\n\\\nLe pion Premier Joueur passe au joueur de gauche et un nouveau tour commence.\\\nLorsque toutes les cartes ont \u00e9t\u00e9 retourn\u00e9es, les scores sont comptabilis\u00e9s.\n\nFin de la partie : Toutes les cartes orthogonales adjacentes portant le m\u00eame num\u00e9ro s'annulent et sont retir\u00e9es du jeu.\\\nChaque joueur compte les valeurs des cartes restantes dans sa grille. But watch out, you will need to keep an eye on your opponents and be one step ahead to win the game!\n\u00a0\nSlide is played over 16 rounds. The game ends when all cards have been revealed and played.\nEach round, players choose any face-down card from their grid and turns it face-up, in the middle of the table ..."},{"id":788,"created_at":"2024-05-22 10:59:49","publication_date":"2024-05-22 14:01:00","text":"*More and more often, you are in for a treat...or two on Board Game Arena!*\n\n\u00a0\n\n**Let me tell you about Flowers: A mandala game.**\n\nIn this game, your goal is to collect flower tiles by achieving majorities through clever card play. Skillfully build mandalas to claim the best tiles, combining and multiplying them to create exquisite flowers of your own!\n\n\u00a0\n\nEach player starts with a hand of cards, with the cards coming in six colors that match the flower tile colors.\n\n\u00a0\n\nOn a turn, a player lays down one or more cards of the same color onto one of the flowers. If that color is already present in the mandala, the player then flips the card(s) face down; if not, the player leaves them face up. If the player laid down one card, they draw two cards from the deck; if they played two or more, they do not draw any cards.\n\n\u00a0\n\nAfter playing, if you have at least one face-up card on a flower and more cards than any other player, take that flower's \"claim\" token and place it on your cards. Then, if that flower now has all six colors face up around it, destroy the mandala.\n\nWhoever has the claim token on their cards places one of the flower tiles from this mandala in front of themselves; if they already have a flower tile of the same color, they flip this \"complete\" flower face down. Whoever has the second most cards on this mandala takes the second flower tile. Anyone who took a flower tile discards all of their played cards on this mandala; everyone else returns their played cards to their hand. Draw a black tile and white tile from the stack to create a new mandala.\n\n\u00a0\n\nContinue play until someone completes their third flower, then everyone scores their points. Each separate flower half is worth as many points as the number of flowers on it. For each complete flower, if one of the tiles is 3x, triple the number of flowers on the other tile; if both tiles have flowers, double the number of flowers on the tile with fewer flowers. Whoever has the most points wins.\n\n\u00a0\n\n<u>Simple, elegant. And you can play it now with 2 to 4 players, right from your browser, by clicking below:<\/u>\n\n<https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/gamepanel?game=flowersmandalagame>\n\n\u00a0\n\nLet us send some love to the **Lookout Games** team for this nice addition to the platform. All of our thanks also goes to the game designers **Trevor Benjamin and Brett J. Gilbert**, and of course, to the developer, **Firgon**, who did an amazing job porting it to BGA.\n\n\u00a0\n\n**And that's not all...**\n\nLet us welcome the all-new expansion added to **Catan: Cities and Knights**!\n\nExpand Catan with a more complex commodity market and knights to defend your cities.\n\n\u00a0\n\nThe game changes the base game in three main ways:\n\nFirst, there are 3 new commodities in the game, distinct from resources- paper, cloth, and coins, which can be acquired from Forest, Meadow, and Mountain spaces, respectively. Cities that would normally produce two of one of those resources instead produce 1 resource and 1 of the corresponding commodity. (To make commodities easier to obtain, each player starts the game with 1 city and 1 settlement on the board.) These commodities allow players to build city improvements that confer various advantages and eventually points.\n\n\u00a0\n\nSecond, the deck of development cards is replaced by three different decks, each corresponding to one of the commodities. Building city improvements gives players a chance to draw these cards with every roll of the dice. Building more improvements will increase these chances, but cards cannot be bought directly in any way. These cards are similar to the development cards in the base game, but with a wider range of effects. (Some cards are balanced better as well- the new Resource Monopoly card, for example, can take no more than 2 of the named resource from any one player.)\n\n\u00a0\n\nFinally, players can also build knights on the island along their network of roads. These knights can be used to claim certain intersections and move the Robber (taking the place of Soldier cards), but are also used to defend the island from periodic barbarian attacks. If the island is successfully defended, the player(s) with the most knights are rewarded. If not, the player(s) with the fewest knights each have a city downgraded to a settlement.\n\n\u00a0\n\n*You can play it by activating the expansion from your game settings before playing, right from the game page.*\n\nLet us thank the **Catan team**, and the work done by **dahrf** to bring it to Board Game Arena!\n\n\u00a0\n\nThat's it for today. ;)\n\nLet's dive into these releases and until next week...\\\n*Take care and play fair!*","title":"FLOWERS: A mandala game & CATAN updates!","keywords":"Available Now!\nNew game + Catan Expansion\nDouble release","forum_topic_id":36772,"text_fr":"*De plus en plus souvent, vous allez vous r\u00e9galer... ou vous faire plaisir sur Board Game Arena !*\n\n\u00a0\n\nLaissez-moi vous parler de **Flowers : un jeu de Mandala.**\n\nDans ce jeu, votre objectif est de collecter des tuiles de fleurs en obtenant des majorit\u00e9s gr\u00e2ce \u00e0 un jeu de cartes astucieux. Construisez habilement des mandalas pour vous approprier les meilleures tuiles, en les combinant et en les multipliant pour cr\u00e9er des fleurs exquises !\n\n\u00a0\n\nChaque joueur commence avec une main de cartes, dont les six couleurs correspondent \u00e0 celles des tuiles de fleurs.\n\n\u00c0 son tour, un joueur pose une ou plusieurs cartes de la m\u00eame couleur sur l'une des fleurs. Si cette couleur est d\u00e9j\u00e0 pr\u00e9sente dans le mandala, le joueur retourne la ou les cartes face cach\u00e9e ; sinon, il les laisse face visible. Si le joueur n'a pos\u00e9 qu'une seule carte, il tire deux cartes de la pioche ; s'il en a pos\u00e9 deux ou plus, il ne tire aucune carte.\n\n\u00a0\n\nApr\u00e8s avoir jou\u00e9, si vous avez au moins une carte face visible sur une fleur et plus de cartes que n'importe quel autre joueur, prenez le jeton \u00ab revendication \u00bb de cette fleur et placez-le sur vos cartes. Ensuite, si cette fleur a maintenant les six couleurs face visible autour d'elle, d\u00e9truisez le mandala.\n\n\u00a0\n\nCelui qui a le jeton de revendication sur ses cartes place l'une des tuiles fleurs de ce mandala devant lui ; s'il a d\u00e9j\u00e0 une tuile fleur de la m\u00eame couleur, il retourne cette fleur \u00ab compl\u00e8te \u00bb face cach\u00e9e. Celui qui a le plus grand nombre de cartes sur ce mandala prend la deuxi\u00e8me tuile fleur. Celui qui a pris une tuile fleur se d\u00e9fausse de toutes ses cartes jou\u00e9es sur ce mandala ; tous les autres retournent leurs cartes jou\u00e9es dans leur main. Tirez une tuile noire et une tuile blanche de la pile pour cr\u00e9er un nouveau mandala.\n\n\u00a0\n\nContinuez \u00e0 jouer jusqu'\u00e0 ce que quelqu'un termine sa troisi\u00e8me fleur, puis tout le monde compte ses points. Chaque moiti\u00e9 de fleur distincte vaut autant de points que le nombre de fleurs qu'elle contient. Pour chaque fleur compl\u00e8te, si l'une des tuiles a 3x, triplez le nombre de fleurs sur l'autre tuile ; si les deux tuiles ont des fleurs, doublez le nombre de fleurs sur la tuile qui en a le moins. Celui qui a le plus de points gagne.\n\n\u00a0\n\n<u>Simple et \u00e9l\u00e9gant. Et vous pouvez y jouer d\u00e8s maintenant de 2 \u00e0 4 joueurs, directement depuis votre navigateur, en cliquant ci-dessous :<\/u>\n\n<https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/gamepanel?game=flowersmandalagame>\n\n\u00a0\n\nNous adressons nos remerciements \u00e0 l'\u00e9quipe de **Lookout Games** pour ce bel ajout \u00e0 la plateforme. Tous nos remerciements vont \u00e9galement aux concepteurs du jeu **Trevor Benjamin et Brett J. Gilbert**, et bien s\u00fbr, au d\u00e9veloppeur, **Firgon**, qui a fait un travail remarquable en portant le jeu sur BGA.\n\n\u00a0\n\n**Et ce n'est pas tout...**\n\n\u00a0\n\nAccueillons la toute nouvelle extension ajout\u00e9e \u00e0 **Catan : Cities and Knights** !\n\nD\u00e9veloppez **Catan** avec un march\u00e9 plus complexe et des chevaliers pour d\u00e9fendre vos villes.\n\n\u00a0\n\n**Le jeu modifie le jeu de base de trois fa\u00e7ons principales :**\n\nTout d'abord, il y a 3 nouvelles marchandises dans le jeu, distinctes des ressources - le papier, le tissu et les pi\u00e8ces de monnaie, qui peuvent \u00eatre acquises dans les espaces For\u00eat, Prairie et Montagne respectivement. Les villes qui devraient normalement produire deux de ces ressources produisent \u00e0 la place 1 ressource et 1 marchandise correspondante. (Pour faciliter l'obtention des marchandises, chaque joueur commence la partie avec 1 ville et 1 colonie sur le plateau). Ces marchandises permettent aux joueurs de construire des villes am\u00e9lior\u00e9es qui leur conf\u00e8rent divers avantages et \u00e9ventuellement des points.\n\n\u00a0\n\nDeuxi\u00e8mement, le paquet de cartes de d\u00e9veloppement est remplac\u00e9 par trois paquets diff\u00e9rents, chacun correspondant \u00e0 l'une des marchandises. En construisant des am\u00e9liorations pour leur ville, les joueurs ont une chance de tirer ces cartes \u00e0 chaque lancer de d\u00e9. Construire plus d'am\u00e9liorations augmentera ces chances, mais les cartes ne peuvent en aucun cas \u00eatre achet\u00e9es directement. Ces cartes sont similaires aux cartes de d\u00e9veloppement du jeu de base, mais leurs effets sont plus vari\u00e9s. (Certaines cartes sont \u00e9galement mieux \u00e9quilibr\u00e9es - la nouvelle carte \"monopole des ressources\", par exemple, ne peut pas prendre plus de 2 ressources \u00e0 un joueur).\n\n\u00a0\n\nEnfin, les joueurs peuvent \u00e9galement construire des chevaliers le long de leur r\u00e9seau de routes. Ces chevaliers peuvent \u00eatre utilis\u00e9s pour revendiquer certaines intersections et d\u00e9placer le voleur (\u00e0 la place des cartes Soldat), mais ils sont \u00e9galement utilis\u00e9s pour d\u00e9fendre l'\u00eele contre les attaques p\u00e9riodiques des barbares. Si l'\u00eele est d\u00e9fendue avec succ\u00e8s, le(s) joueur(s) ayant le plus de chevaliers est (sont) r\u00e9compens\u00e9(s). Dans le cas contraire, le(s) joueur(s) ayant le moins de chevaliers voit(nt) sa(leurs) ville(s) d\u00e9class\u00e9e(s) en colonie.\n\n\u00a0\n\n*Vous pouvez y jouer en activant l'extension dans vos param\u00e8tres de jeu avant de jouer, directement depuis la page de jeu.*\n\n\u00a0\n\nRemercions l'\u00e9quipe de **Catan**, et le travail effectu\u00e9 par **dahrf** pour l'amener sur Board Game Arena !\n\n\u00a0\n\nC'est tout pour aujourd'hui ;)\n\nPlongeons dans ces nouveaut\u00e9s et \u00e0 la semaine prochaine...\\\n*Prenez soin de vous et jouez honn\u00eatement !*","title_fr":"FLOWERS: un jeu Mandala & Mise \u00e0 jour CATAN !","keywords_fr":"Disponible Maintenant !\nNouveau jeu + Extension CATAN\nDouble sortie","forum_topic_id_fr":36773,"comments_count":23,"comments_count_fr":4,"image_timestamp":"2024-05-22 10:59:49","publish_on_bga":true,"publish_on_forum":true,"game_ids":[1978,1539],"colors":["#A19F71","#6b6a47","#6d8155","#4d3f33"],"blurhash":"LYLp{H~8=?s:%2NFkDxYIwSK$yt7","priority":2,"image_url":"https:\/\/x.boardgamearena.net\/data\/newsimg\/news-banner-788.jpg?ts=1716397189","image_url_400":"https:\/\/x.boardgamearena.net\/data\/newsimg\/news-banner-788_400.jpg?ts=1716397189","status":{"bga":{"status":"published","url":"https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/news?id=788"},"forum":{"status":"published","url":"https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/forum\/viewtopic.php?t=36772"},"forum_fr":{"status":"published","url":"https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/forum\/viewtopic.php?t=36773"}},"translation":{"translated":false,"lang":"en","human_translated_percent":null,"human_translated_category":null,"human_translated_message":null,"original_text":"*More and more often, you are in for a treat...or two on Board Game Arena!*\n\n\u00a0\n\n**Let me tell you about Flowers: A mandala game.**\n\nIn this game, your goal is to collect flower tiles by achieving majorities through clever card play. Skillfully build mandalas to claim the best tiles, combining and multiplying them to create exquisite flowers of your own!\n\n\u00a0\n\nEach player starts with a hand of cards, with the cards coming in six colors that match the flower tile colors.\n\n\u00a0\n\nOn a turn, a player lays down one or more cards of the same color onto one of the flowers. If that color is already present in the mandala, the player then flips the card(s) face down; if not, the player leaves them face up. If the player laid down one card, they draw two cards from the deck; if they played two or more, they do not draw any cards.\n\n\u00a0\n\nAfter playing, if you have at least one face-up card on a flower and more cards than any other player, take that flower's \"claim\" token and place it on your cards. Then, if that flower now has all six colors face up around it, destroy the mandala.\n\nWhoever has the claim token on their cards places one of the flower tiles from this mandala in front of themselves; if they already have a flower tile of the same color, they flip this \"complete\" flower face down. Whoever has the second most cards on this mandala takes the second flower tile. Anyone who took a flower tile discards all of their played cards on this mandala; everyone else returns their played cards to their hand. Draw a black tile and white tile from the stack to create a new mandala.\n\n\u00a0\n\nContinue play until someone completes their third flower, then everyone scores their points. Each separate flower half is worth as many points as the number of flowers on it. For each complete flower, if one of the tiles is 3x, triple the number of flowers on the other tile; if both tiles have flowers, double the number of flowers on the tile with fewer flowers. Whoever has the most points wins.\n\n\u00a0\n\n<u>Simple, elegant. And you can play it now with 2 to 4 players, right from your browser, by clicking below:<\/u>\n\n<https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/gamepanel?game=flowersmandalagame>\n\n\u00a0\n\nLet us send some love to the **Lookout Games** team for this nice addition to the platform. All of our thanks also goes to the game designers **Trevor Benjamin and Brett J. Gilbert**, and of course, to the developer, **Firgon**, who did an amazing job porting it to BGA.\n\n\u00a0\n\n**And that's not all...**\n\nLet us welcome the all-new expansion added to **Catan: Cities and Knights**!\n\nExpand Catan with a more complex commodity market and knights to defend your cities.\n\n\u00a0\n\nThe game changes the base game in three main ways:\n\nFirst, there are 3 new commodities in the game, distinct from resources- paper, cloth, and coins, which can be acquired from Forest, Meadow, and Mountain spaces, respectively. Cities that would normally produce two of one of those resources instead produce 1 resource and 1 of the corresponding commodity. (To make commodities easier to obtain, each player starts the game with 1 city and 1 settlement on the board.) These commodities allow players to build city improvements that confer various advantages and eventually points.\n\n\u00a0\n\nSecond, the deck of development cards is replaced by three different decks, each corresponding to one of the commodities. Building city improvements gives players a chance to draw these cards with every roll of the dice. Building more improvements will increase these chances, but cards cannot be bought directly in any way. These cards are similar to the development cards in the base game, but with a wider range of effects. (Some cards are balanced better as well- the new Resource Monopoly card, for example, can take no more than 2 of the named resource from any one player.)\n\n\u00a0\n\nFinally, players can also build knights on the island along their network of roads. These knights can be used to claim certain intersections and move the Robber (taking the place of Soldier cards), but are also used to defend the island from periodic barbarian attacks. If the island is successfully defended, the player(s) with the most knights are rewarded. If not, the player(s) with the fewest knights each have a city downgraded to a settlement.\n\n\u00a0\n\n*You can play it by activating the expansion from your game settings before playing, right from the game page.*\n\nLet us thank the **Catan team**, and the work done by **dahrf** to bring it to Board Game Arena!\n\n\u00a0\n\nThat's it for today. ;)\n\nLet's dive into these releases and until next week...\\\n*Take care and play fair!*","original_title":"FLOWERS: A mandala game & CATAN updates!","original_keywords":"Available Now!\nNew game + Catan Expansion\nDouble release"},"text_excerpt":"More and more often, you are in for a treat...or two on Board Game Arena!\n\u00a0\nLet me tell you about Flowers: A mandala game.\nIn this game, your goal is to collect flower tiles by achieving majorities through clever card play. Skillfully build mandalas to claim the best tiles, combining and multiplying them to create exquisite flowers of your own!\n\u00a0\nEach player starts with a hand of cards, with the ..."},{"id":787,"created_at":"2024-05-17 14:56:23","publication_date":"2024-05-20 14:00:00","text":"***Trailblazers*** are the gutsy folks who pave and brave the trails of the great outdoors.\n\n\u00a0\n\nWhether with hiking boots, cycling wheels, or river paddle, these tenacious travelors seek to feed their insatiable appetite for adventure.\u00a0 With a scenic wilderness ever ahead and a freshly charted path under the heels, one must not forget to eventually find their way back to camp.\u00a0 There are always new environments to explore, further expeditions to undertake, and more trails to blaze.\n\n\u00a0\n\nIn *Trailblazers*, players compete to earn the most points by building biking, hiking, and kayaking loops from their campsites of the matching trail type. Each round, players are dealt eight trail cards where they will draft two cards, arrange those cards in their personal area, and pass their hand to the next player three times. Cards must either be placed adjacent to or overlapping other cards. While players can push their luck by aiming to construct long and elaborate trails, only closed loops that start and end at a matching campsite will score points. Players also compete to fulfil \u201cFirst To\u201d and \u201cEnd Game\u201d goal cards. After four rounds, the game ends and the player with the most points from closed loops and goal cards wins.\n\n\u00a0\n\n<u>36 missions for solo players, plenty of options for up to 8 players: a wonderful way to play the game the way you want, but relaxed. Avec un paysage sauvage devant soi et un chemin fra\u00eechement trac\u00e9 sur les talons, il ne faut pas oublier de retrouver le chemin du camp. Car il y a toujours de nouveaux environnements \u00e0 explorer, de nouvelles exp\u00e9ditions \u00e0 entreprendre et de nouveaux sentiers \u00e0 tracer.\n\n\u00a0\n\nDans ***Trailblazers***, les joueurs s'affrontent pour gagner le plus de points en construisant des boucles de v\u00e9lo, de randonn\u00e9e et de kayak \u00e0 partir de leur campement, selon le type de sentier correspondant. \u00c0 chaque tour, les joueurs re\u00e7oivent huit cartes de sentier. Ils en tirent deux, les placent dans leur zone personnelle et passent leur main au joueur suivant trois fois. Les cartes doivent \u00eatre soit adjacentes, soit superpos\u00e9es \u00e0 d'autres cartes. Les joueurs peuvent tenter leur chance en construisant des pistes longues et \u00e9labor\u00e9es, mais seules les boucles ferm\u00e9es qui commencent et se terminent \u00e0 un emplacement de camping correspondant rapporteront des points. Les joueurs s'affrontent \u00e9galement pour remplir les cartes d'objectifs \u00ab Premier \u00e0 \u00bb et \u00ab Fin de partie \u00bb. Apr\u00e8s quatre tours, le jeu se termine et le joueur qui a obtenu le plus de points gr\u00e2ce aux boucles ferm\u00e9es et aux cartes d'objectif gagne.\n\n\u00a0\n\n<u>36 missions pour les joueurs solos, de nombreuses options pour un maximum de 8 joueurs : une merveilleuse fa\u00e7on de jouer au jeu comme vous l'entendez, mais en toute d\u00e9contraction. And it is time to witness the beauty of nature, through a game named **Boreal**, like the aurora.\n\n\u00a0\n\nImmerse yourself in a world where Nature has claimed what is rightfully hers, accompanying two young explorers on their adventure. Through the methodical construction of a pyramid of cards, each representing a place to be discovered, you will chart your course and carve out your destiny in this thrilling experience.\n\n\u00a0\n\n**Boreal** is more than just an ordinary card game: it offers a unique strategic experience, specially designed for two players. Excel at managing your resources and choose your card locations wisely in your pyramid to maximize your victory point harvest.\n\n\u00a0\n\n<u>There is, of course, a <\/u>[<u>tutorial<\/u>](https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/tutorial?game=boreal)<u> to learn the game, and you can click the link below to discover even more information and play it!<\/u>\n\n<https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/gamepanel?game=boreal>\n\n\u00a0\n\nWe would love to thank **Spiral Editions** for the rights to bring this game to the platform, as well as the game designer **Masafumi Mizuno**.\n\nNothing would have been possible without the work done by **firgon**, and he deserves some love for this!\n\n\u00a0\n\n**SOLSTIS:**\n\n*\"The solstice is an astronomical event that occurs twice a year, when the apparent position of the sun reaches its greatest northward or southward inclination with respect to the celestial equator. This results in the longest or shortest day of the year.\"* And it's gonna happen in a bit more than a month, on the 20th of June. And we wanted you to be prepared...\n\n\u00a0\n\nProve your worth and and collect the most stars by traveling the mountain and assembling as many landscape tiles as possible, meeting the forest spirits and lighting fires on the peaks creating a path through the valley.\n\n\u00a0\n\nThe tile capture mechanisms are taken from the hanafuda mechanisms. Collect a tile according to the column or row then place them in your landscape. The goal of the game will be to reconstruct a landscape by combining its tiles to score as many points as possible. You will have to be careful not to leave tiles to your opponent while optimizing your landscape according to your opponent's choices.\n\nAlso, create tile squares to collect spirits that will help you during or at the end of the game.\\\nThe experience is zen and very quick to set up, fun for adults and children!\n\n\u00a0\n\n<u>Solstis also offers a <\/u>[<u>tutorial you can play<\/u>](https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/tutorial?game=solstis)<u> to learn, or simply dive to the game page to start a game by clicking the link below:<\/u>\n\n<https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/gamepanel?game=solstis>\n\n\u00a0\n\nWe would thank, as usual, the people behind the game that made it possible for you to play it online: **Lumberjacks Studio**, the publisher, as well as **Bruno Cathala & Corentin Lebrat**, the game designers.\\\nThe game has been beautifully ported to Board Game Arena by **Moof** and he also deserves, like all developers, some love for the work done here.\\\n\\\n**And that's it for today!**\n\n*Two games on a Monday, that's the start to a great week.*\\\n\\\nEnjoy these very original and different titles, let us know which one got your favor,\n\nand as always...\\\n*Take care and play fair!*\n\n\u00a0","title":"BOREAL & SOLSTIS: Dual releases in the sky!","keywords":"Available now!\n2 players\n20 mins","forum_topic_id":36615,"text_fr":"**Deux jeux, pour deux joueurs, en une seule journ\u00e9e !**\n\n\u00a0\n\n**BOREAL:**\n\n*\u00ab Nous vivons actuellement la plus grande temp\u00eate solaire de ces 20 derni\u00e8res ann\u00e9es \u00bb*, explique l'Agence spatiale europ\u00e9enne dans un message aux m\u00e9dias. Et c'est le moment de t\u00e9moigner de la beaut\u00e9 de la nature, \u00e0 travers un jeu baptis\u00e9 **Boreal**, comme les aurores.\n\n\u00a0\n\nPlongez dans un monde o\u00f9 la nature a repris ses droits, en accompagnant deux jeunes explorateurs dans leur aventure. Par la construction m\u00e9thodique d'une pyramide de cartes, chacune repr\u00e9sentant un lieu \u00e0 d\u00e9couvrir, vous tracerez votre route et sculpterez votre destin dans cette exp\u00e9rience passionnante.\n\n\u00a0\n\nPlus qu'un simple jeu de cartes, **Bor\u00e9al** propose une exp\u00e9rience strat\u00e9gique unique, sp\u00e9cialement con\u00e7ue pour deux joueurs. G\u00e9rez au mieux vos ressources et choisissez judicieusement l'emplacement de vos cartes dans votre pyramide pour maximiser votre r\u00e9colte de points de victoire.\n\n\u00a0\n\n<u>Il y a bien s\u00fbr un <\/u>[<u>tutoriel <\/u>](https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/tutorial?game=boreal)<u>pour apprendre le jeu, ou vous pouvez cliquer sur le lien ci-dessous pour en d\u00e9couvrir plus sur le jeu, et y jouer!<\/u>\n\n<https:\/\/boardgamearena.com\/gamepanel?game=boreal>\n\n\u00a0\n\nNous tenons \u00e0 remercier **Spiral Editions** pour les droits de diffusion de ce jeu sur la plateforme, ainsi que le game designer **Masafumi Mizuno**.\n\nRien n'aurait \u00e9t\u00e9 possible sans le travail effectu\u00e9 par **firgon**, et il m\u00e9rite un peu d'amour pour cela !\n\n\u00a0\n\n**SOLSTIS:**\n\n*\u00ab Le solstice est un \u00e9v\u00e9nement astronomique qui se produit deux fois par an, lorsque la position apparente du soleil atteint sa plus grande inclinaison vers le nord ou vers le sud par rapport \u00e0 l'\u00e9quateur c\u00e9leste. Il en r\u00e9sulte le jour le plus long ou le plus court de l'ann\u00e9e \u00bb*. Et cela se produira dans un peu plus d'un mois, le 20 juin. Et nous voulions que vous soyez pr\u00eats...\n\n\u00a0\n\nProuvez votre valeur et collectez le plus d'\u00e9toiles en parcourant la montagne et en assemblant autant de tuiles de paysage que possible, en rencontrant les esprits de la for\u00eat et en allumant des feux sur les sommets pour cr\u00e9er un chemin \u00e0 travers la vall\u00e9e.\n\n\u00a0\n\nLes m\u00e9canismes de capture des tuiles sont inspir\u00e9s des m\u00e9canismes de l'hanafuda. Ramassez une tuile en fonction de la colonne ou de la ligne, puis placez-la dans votre paysage. Le but du jeu sera de reconstituer un paysage en combinant ses tuiles pour marquer le plus de points possible. Vous devrez faire attention \u00e0 ne pas laisser de tuiles \u00e0 votre adversaire tout en optimisant votre paysage en fonction de ses choix.\n\n\u00a0\n\nDe plus, cr\u00e9ez des carr\u00e9s de tuiles pour collecter des esprits qui vous aideront pendant ou \u00e0 la fin de la partie. \\\nL'exp\u00e9rience est zen et tr\u00e8s rapide \u00e0 mettre en place, pour les adultes comme pour les
